definition: tip of the iceberg
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
surname Jue

sentences.english: Think of the word you see on the page as only the tip of an iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 想想看，您在頁面上看到的一個單詞只是冰山一角。

sentences.english: And yet I have told thee but a tithe of what was there.
sentences.chinese: 但我說的這一切，都不過是冰山一角。

sentences.english: Maybe enough three township of the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 也許還不夠三鄉的冰山一角。

sentences.english: However, it is only a tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這只是假新聞的冰山一角。

sentences.english: And suicide is only the tip of an iceberg of work-related unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 而自殺也只是工作不開心表現中的冰山一角。

sentences.english: But lost stock is only part of the story.
sentences.chinese: 但損失的魚量只是冰山一角。

sentences.english: The ironic thing here is that he is UNDERSHOOTING it.
sentences.chinese: 諷刺的是他說的只是冰山一角。

sentences.english: The recent Microsoft brouhaha over paid editing is the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 最近關於微軟有償編輯的騷動就是冰山一角。

sentences.english: Sold-out arenas were the just the tip of the iceberg, Pastuszek believes.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯圖斯澤克相信，球館爆滿僅僅只是冰山一角。

sentences.english: This is just one more piece in building a case file.
sentences.chinese: 這只是建立卷宗的冰山一角而已。

sentences.english: The Tiangong-1 is an essential step toward the goal of building a space station.
sentences.chinese: 天宮僅僅是組成中國廣大的空間探測項目的冰山一角。

sentences.english: Sanlu, no doubt, is just the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，三鹿毒奶事件只是冰山一角。

sentences.english: Its problems were merely "the lip of the iceberg" lacing American industry.
sentences.chinese: 其問題就是牽繫着美國工業的“冰山一角”。

sentences.english: And that killing goats with psychic powers was just the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 而用特異功能使山羊斃命僅僅是冰山一角而已。

sentences.english: This is the tip of the iceberg for any given sign.
And that is just a tiny bit of the stress and aggravation associated with running a business.
sentences.chinese: 這些生意上的壓力和苦惱，還只不過是冰山一角而已。

definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
lit. one hair from nine oxen (idiom)/fig. a drop in the ocean
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
outward appearance/superficial/(philosophy, psychology) representation/idea/(math.) representation
inside story/non-public information/behind the scenes/internal
rarely known to anyone (idiom); almost unknown/secret to all but a few
to uncover/to open
not known to anyone/secret/unknown
specific example/rare instance
a drop in the ocean (idiom)
a list/to list/to enumerate
the truth about sth/the actual facts
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
too many to count (idiom); innumerable
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
complete picture/full view
